eligibility:
10+2 level (Karnataka PUC, ISCE, CBSE, NIOS, other State Boards), and any recognized bodies in India. It is compulsory to have studied any two subjects â€“ Biology (Botany/Zoology), and Chemistry, at the Class 12 th Level.
Candidates writing the +2 examinations in March-May 2025 may apply with their class X and XI marks.
Students pursuing International curriculum must note that eligibility is according to AIU stipulations:
Applicants pursuing IB curriculum must have 3 HL and 3 SL with 24 credits.
Applicants pursuing GCE / Edexcel must have a minimum of 3 A levels with a grade not less than C.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Diverse career opportunities in biotechnology and botany. Multidisciplinary approach for comprehensive skill development. Extensive practical experience through hands-on training. Enhanced understanding of biological and environmental sciences. Tailored curriculum fostering critical thinking abilities. Pathway to cutting-edge research and innovation.
what_learn: What you will learn? Comprehensive understanding of plant and animal diversity. Practical insights into ecological and evolutionary biology. Application of biotechnology and bioinformatics in research. In-depth knowledge of genetics and plant breeding. Specialized skills in pharmaceutical and applied microbiology. Proficiency in statistical analysis and data interpretation.
modules: Modules Exploration of evolutionary patterns and comparative anatomy. Practical skills in mushroom cultivation and apiculture. In-depth knowledge of plant anatomy and biology. Year 1 Understanding of diverse plant and animal species. Multidisciplinary exposure to environmental studies. Holistic Education Exploration of functional ecology and animal physiology. Practical skills in gardening and nursery management. Proficiency in micro-techniques for biological sciences. Year 2 Comprehensive understanding of angiosperm systematics and taxonomy. Applied knowledge in dairy technology and herbal technology. Enhanced English and holistic education curriculum. Advanced knowledge of plant biotechnology and bioinformatics. Comprehensive understanding of genetics and plant breeding. In-depth insights into plant physiology and metabolism. Year 3 Practical experience in immunology and molecular biology. Proficiency in parasitology and genetic engineering techniques. Application of biostatistics and mathematical biology principles. Profound understanding of research methodology principles. Competency in data analysis using statistical software. In-depth knowledge of pharmaceutical botany & applied microbiology. Year 4 Comprehensive insights into food, nutrition, and health. Practical experience in fungal biotechnology and applied plant physiology. Exploration of disease biology and computational biology.
career: Career prospects Research positions in biodiversity conservation. Biotechnology and pharmaceutical industry opportunities. Agricultural and horticultural development careers. Academic roles in life sciences education. Environmental and ecological consultancy positions. Laboratory and scientific research occupations.
